moves.1. e4 e5 2. f4 exf4 3. Nf3 g5 4. Bc4 g4: The starting position for all the games.
moves.9. g3 Qh5 10. Nf2: First task accomplished: I've blocked off Black's dangerously advanced Pawns.
moves.10... c6 11. h3 Qg6 12. hxg4 Nxg4 13. Qx: And now I've won back the gambited Pawn and evened the material. Now I can focus on generating my own attack.
moves.16... Qxg4 17. Nxg4: I'll gladly accept the exchange of Queens.
moves.17... Nd7 18. Bf4 d5 19. exd5 cxd5 20. N: I finally finish clearing my back rank.
moves.20... O-O-O 21. Re1: Naturally, I take the open file.
moves.22... h5 23. Nf2 b5 24. Nb3 Nb6 25. Be5: I force the exchange of another set of minors.
moves.25... Bxe5 26. Rxe5: I'll add a Pawn to my material collection...
moves.27... Rxh4 28. gxh4: Black should avoid swapping down. The simpler the position gets, the more telling is my material advantage.
moves.28... Rg8+ 29. Rg5: I suspect Black overlooked this riposte.
moves.29... Rh8 30. Kg3 f6 31. Rg6 Rf8 32. Ng4: I need to eliminate Black's final resource, the passed KBP.
moves.36... Kc7 37. Nf3 a5 38. Rg5 Kc6 39. Rf5: With the Pawn slated to fall, Black resigns.
